newsitem.title: UK: UK housing starts fall s/a eight pct 3 mths to May.
newsitem.headline: UK housing starts fall s/a eight pct 3 mths to May.

text.p: British housing starts fell eight percent in the three months to May while total completions were broadly unchanged, the Department of the Environment said on Thursday.
In the latest three months 50,400 dwellings were started, up 11 percent on the same three months a year ago, while completions at 43,600 were up three per cent.
Private enterprise starts were down 10 percent while completions were up by four percent.
Housing Association starts of new dwellings in the three months March to May increased compared with the previous three months. However completions fell back.
Both starts and completions by local authorities and government departments remained at a low level.

In the month of May itself, it was provisionally estimated that 16,300 dwellings were started in Britain compared with 15,600 in May 1996. Completions numbered 13,800 compared with 13,900 in the previous year, the DoE said.
